posts.post_content:
These have been sold pending payment.

I have a lot of (61) T206s for sale here  - no duplicates are included. These are all pretty low-grade - some worse than others. Some are beaters and others are more reasonable. Flaws can include creasing, stains, pinholes, paper loss, tears, trimmed, etc. Some are presentable but make no mistake, these are lower-end type cards.

If you ever wanted a nice head start on a T206 set, this is it.

I am NOT selling these individually right now and I'm just looking to unload them all at once. If they do not sell as a group, I would break them up but for now, these are being sold as one lot.

Highlights include:
Marquard throwing (Sweet Cap overstrike Factory 42)
Bender Polar Bear throwing no trees (Polar Bear) - card is in decent shape with no major creasing or major paper loss but has pinhole
Walsh (trimmed)
Rockenfeld Southern Leaguer
Westlake Southern Leaguer
Birmingham Horizontal
Pattee Horizontal

Also included are:
Abbott (SOVEREIGN)
Ames hands up
Anderson
Armbruster
Arndt
Atz
Barry
Bell throwing
Berger (POLAR BEAR)
Blackburne
Bradley
Brashear
Bridwell no cap
Burchell

Butler
Chappelle
Conroy bat (POLAR BEAR)
Conroy glove
Donlin bat (POLAR BEAR)
Dorner
Egan
Elberfeld fielding (POLAR BEAR)
Fromme (SOVEREIGN)
Graham throwing
Herzog

McGann

Pelty vertical
Phelan
Pickering

Scott
Sharpe
Slagle
Stovall (SOVEREIGN)
Street glove (POLAR BEAR)
Tenney
Wilhelm ball
Wilhelm bat
Willett bat
Irv Young

Some of the commons are a little harder to find. 

Please note that the Bescher card shown is NOT part of this lot. In addition, only 59 cards (other than Bescher are sold). The other two didn't fit in the scans (Wilhelm ball and Willett bat) but are included. Both are Piedmonts, Wilhelm is trimmed and Willett is missing a corner. Both have clean backs.

Most backs are fairly common ones, but about 1/5 are tougher backs. In all, there are four Sovereign, six Polar Bear, one Sweet Caporal overprint.

NOW ASKING $$OLD PENDING PAYMENT (net to me via Paypal) for these - that includes shipping, tracking, and insurance. This is a good way to bang out more than 1/10 of the set all at once and again, there are no duplicates here. Please feel free to PM any questions.

I have scanned these in but please feel free to inquire about individual cards.

Thanks -
One time price bump to $650.00 before these go off to eBay on Thursday. Thanks.

Don't need all of them. But would like some of them.
I'm sure I'm not alone on here, but take them to eBay if you need to.
Best of luck to you.:)

[quote name="xplainer" post=1478098]Don't need all of them. But would like some of them.
I'm sure I'm not alone on here, but take them to eBay if you need to.
Best of luck to you.:)[/QUOTE]

Hi Jimmy - thanks. Yes there was some interest individually but I didn't want the headache of breaking them up and sending to 40-60 addresses :)

As of last night, these have been sold.

Whats with the Marquard throwing. I Dont think that I ever saw one with an orange shirt before.

John P

[quote name="JohnP0621" post=1478460]Whats with the Marquard throwing. I Dont think that I ever saw one with an orange shirt before.

John P[/QUOTE]

I don't have it in front of me but it was colored in with something.
